  • Method Details

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard​(Box[][] board)
      Prints the board.
      Parameters:
      board - bi-dimensional array of boxes representing the game board.

    • acquirePlayerCredentials

      public void acquirePlayerCredentials()
      Acquires username and age of the player from command line and stores them in the credentials HashMap.

    • acquireNumberOfPlayers

      public void acquireNumberOfPlayers()
      Acquires game's number of players and stores it into a local variable.

    • acquireWorkerSelection

      public boolean acquireWorkerSelection()
      Asks player which worker he wants to use.
      Returns:
      true if the choice is the male worker, false if it's the female Worker.

    • acquireBooleanChoice

      public boolean acquireBooleanChoice()
      Keeps asking the user for a string ("y" or "n") until correct input is entered.
      Returns:
      true if the given string is "y", false otherwise.

    • acquireCoordinates

      public int[] acquireCoordinates()
      Asks coordinates which player wants to move.
      Returns:
      an array containing the selected coordinates.

    • acquireInteger

      public int acquireInteger​(java.lang.String errorMessage)
      Asks an integer until input is valid.
      Parameters:
      errorMessage - message to print for error.
      Returns:
      the given number.

    • challengerCardsSetup

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String> challengerCardsSetup​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String> deck)
      Asks the challenger to select a God Power Card for each player.
      Parameters:
      deck - the HashMap containing the id and the name of every card in the game.
      Returns:
      an HashMap containing the selected cards.

    • acquireStartPlayerSelection

      public int acquireStartPlayerSelection​(java.util.Vector<Player> players)
      Asks the Challenger to chose the starting player.
      Parameters:
      players - the vector containing all players in the game.
      Returns:
      the index of the designed player.
